programme.title: Bloodfist
programme.desc: Don Wilson plays retired kickboxer Jake Raye, who travels to Manila, where his brother is favored to win a kickboxing competition.

programme.title: Battle Creek Brawl
programme.desc: Jerry Kwan is a Korean man seeking fame and fortune in Chicago in the 1930s. But his serene life is turned upside-down when the merciless head of a mobster syndicate takes his brother's fianc√©e hostage.

programme.title: Bodyguards And Assassins
programme.desc: In 1905, revolutionist Sun Yat-Sen visits Hong Kong to discuss plans with Tongmenghui members to overthrow the Qing dynasty. But when they find out that assassins have been sent to kill him, they assemble a group of protectors to prevent any attacks.

programme.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
programme.desc: Adapted from his Pulitzer Prize-winning play, Glengarry Glen Ross shows David Mamet at his searing, profane best. A group of Chicago real-estate salesmen-cum-con artists live on the edge. Life is good for the one on a roll. For the rest, life hangs in the balance. There is no room for losers. A-B-C: Always Be Closing, sell or go under, is the salesman's mantra. With the pressure on, so begins a rainy night of cutthroat business and shattered lives.

programme.title: Chopper
programme.desc: Chopper tells the intense story of Mark "Chopper" Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison. His book, "From the Inside", upon which the film is based, was a best-seller.

programme.title: 10th And Wolf
programme.desc: A former street tough returns to his Philadelphia home after a stint in the military. Back on his home turf, he once again finds himself tangling with the mob boss who was instrumental in his going off to be a soldier.

programme.title: Red Riding: 1974
programme.desc: Rookie journalist Eddie Dunford is determined to find the truth in an increasingly complex maze of lies and deceit surrounding the police investigation into a series of child abductions.

programme.title: Red Riding: 1980
programme.desc: The Home Office bring in senior Manchester detective Peter Hunter to conduct a secret review of the Ripper investigation to date.

programme.title: Red Riding: 1983
programme.desc: When another child goes missing, washed-up solicitor John Piggott unwittingly provides a catalyst for Detective Chief Superindent Maurice Jobson to start to right some wrongs.

programme.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
programme.desc: Adapted from his Pulitzer Prize-winning play, Glengarry Glen Ross shows David Mamet at his searing, profane best. A group of Chicago real-estate salesmen-cum-con artists live on the edge. Life is good for the one on a roll. For the rest, life hangs in the balance. There is no room for losers.
